publicFunctions.details: Allocates an area of memory available to Thrust's cuda system. Allocates a typed area of memory available to Thrust's cuda system.
publicFunctions.name: malloc
note: The cuda::pointer<void> returned by this function must be deallocated with cuda::free.
The cuda::pointer<T> returned by this function must be deallocated with cuda::free.
returns: A cuda::pointer<void> pointing to the beginning of the newly allocated memory. A null cuda::pointer<void> is returned if an error occurs.
A cuda::pointer<T> pointing to the beginning of the newly allocated elements. A null cuda::pointer<T> is returned if an error occurs.
publicFunctions.title: malloc

publicFunctions.details: Deallocates an area of memory previously allocated by cuda::malloc.
publicFunctions.name: free

paramList.name: ptr
paramList.text: A cuda::pointer<void> pointing to the beginning of an area of memory previously allocated with cuda::malloc.

publicFunctions.title: free

publicTypes.definition: using cuda_cub::allocator = typedef thrust::mr::stateless_resource_allocator< T, thrust::system::cuda::memory_resource >
publicTypes.details: cuda::allocator is the default allocator used by the cuda system's containers such as cuda::vector if no user-specified allocator is provided. cuda::allocator allocates (deallocates) storage with cuda::malloc (cuda::free).
publicTypes.name: allocator
publicTypes.title: allocator

publicTypes.details: cuda::universal_allocator allocates memory that can be used by the cuda system and host systems.
publicTypes.name: universal_allocator
publicTypes.title: universal_allocator

publicTypes.definition: using cuda_cub::pointer = typedef thrust::pointer< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag, thrust::tagged_reference<T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag> >
publicTypes.details: cuda::pointer stores a pointer to an object allocated in memory accessible by the cuda system. This type provides type safety when dispatching algorithms on ranges resident in cuda memory. cuda::pointer has pointer semantics: it may be dereferenced and manipulated with pointer arithmetic. cuda::pointer can be created with the function cuda::malloc, or by explicitly calling its constructor with a raw pointer. The raw pointer encapsulated by a cuda::pointer may be obtained by eiter its get member function or the raw_pointer_cast function.
publicTypes.name: pointer
note: cuda::pointer is not a "smart" pointer; it is the programmer's responsibility to deallocate memory pointed to by cuda::pointer.

templateParamsList.name: T
templateParamsList.text: specifies the type of the pointee.

publicTypes.title: pointer
publicTypes.type: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag, thrust::tagged_reference< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag > >
publicTypes.typePlain: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag, thrust::tagged_reference< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag > >

publicTypes.definition: using cuda_cub::universal_pointer = typedef thrust::pointer< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag, typename std::add_lvalue_reference<T>::type >
publicTypes.details: cuda::universal_pointer stores a pointer to an object allocated in memory accessible by the cuda system and host systems. cuda::universal_pointer has pointer semantics: it may be dereferenced and manipulated with pointer arithmetic. cuda::universal_pointer can be created with cuda::universal_allocator or by explicitly calling its constructor with a raw pointer. The raw pointer encapsulated by a cuda::universal_pointer may be obtained by eiter its get member function or the raw_pointer_cast function.
publicTypes.name: universal_pointer
note: cuda::universal_pointer is not a "smart" pointer; it is the programmer's responsibility to deallocate memory pointed to by cuda::universal_pointer.

templateParamsList.name: T
templateParamsList.text: specifies the type of the pointee.

publicTypes.title: universal_pointer
publicTypes.type: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag, typename std::add_lvalue_reference< T >::type >
publicTypes.typePlain: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::cuda_cub::tag, typename std::add_lvalue_reference< T >::type >

publicTypes.details: cuda::reference is a wrapped reference to an object stored in memory accessible by the cuda system. cuda::reference is the type of the result of dereferencing a cuda::pointer.
publicTypes.name: reference

templateParamsList.name: T
templateParamsList.text: Specifies the type of the referenced object.

publicTypes.title: reference

publicTypes.details: cuda::vector is a container that supports random access to elements, constant time removal of elements at the end, and linear time insertion and removal of elements at the beginning or in the middle. The number of elements in a cuda::vector may vary dynamically; memory management is automatic. The elements contained in a cuda::vector reside in memory accessible by the cuda system.
publicTypes.name: vector
see: host_vector For the documentation of the complete interface which is shared by cuda::vector

templateParamsList.name: Allocator
templateParamsList.text: The allocator type of the cuda::vector. Defaults to cuda::allocator.

publicTypes.title: vector

publicTypes.details: cuda::universal_vector is a container that supports random access to elements, constant time removal of elements at the end, and linear time insertion and removal of elements at the beginning or in the middle. The number of elements in a cuda::universal_vector may vary dynamically; memory management is automatic. The elements contained in a cuda::universal_vector reside in memory accessible by the cuda system and host systems.
publicTypes.name: universal_vector
see: host_vector For the documentation of the complete interface which is shared by cuda::universal_vector

templateParamsList.name: Allocator
templateParamsList.text: The allocator type of the cuda::universal_vector. Defaults to cuda::universal_allocator.

publicTypes.title: universal_vector
